comments.author: simona.marcu@softvision.com
comments.text:
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:6.0a1) Gecko/20110413 Firefox/6.0a1

Hitting shortcut keys Ctrl+Shift+H while the History menu is displayed takes you to the Home page.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to reproduce:
1. Invoke the History menu using the keyboard shortcut: Alt+S
2. While the History dropdown menu is displayed hit the keys Ctrl+Shift+H to access the Show All Bookmarks.

Actual results:
Hitting Ctrl+Shift+H takes you to the Home page.

Expected results:
Library window is opened.
comments.creator: simona.marcu@softvision.com
comments.raw_text:

comments.author: simona.marcu@softvision.com
comments.text: I also noticed that when hitting Ctrl+Shift+Y while the Tools menu is displayed through keyboards Alt+T, takes you to the Firefox Sync Setup window.
comments.raw_text: I also noticed that when hitting Ctrl+Shift+Y while the Tools menu is displayed through keyboards Alt+T, takes you to the Firefox Sync Setup window.

comments.creator: enndeakin@gmail.com
comments.text:
> Expected results:
> Library window is opened.

Actually, the expected result is to do nothing.

The fix here is to only handle menu accelerators when no modifiers are pressed (although Windows allows Shift to be pressed)
comments.author: enndeakin@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
> Expected results:
> Library window is opened.

Actually, the expected result is to do nothing.

The fix here is to only handle menu accelerators when no modifiers are pressed (although Windows allows Shift to be pressed)
